reviews.text: We grabbed a late-night vegan pizza to go. It was like, almost 10 pm. They had a DJ and booze. Ordering was simple. We got a pizza with eggplant and meatless sausage, no dairy cheese. It was so good, and the garlic knots were the perfect side.

The staff was so understanding! We had just got in town and ended up at the store longer than expected and was an hour late almost to pickup our online order. Everything was still nice and hot! The food itself was fantastic we are going for seconds before heading out of town.

Without a doubt the least flavorful pizza I can remember. The most expensive pizza I can remember. The crust was not good at all. The ‚Äúcheesy breadsticks‚Äù were a piece of melted cheese over a piece of white bread. Maybe they were just having a bad night on Sunday 5/25/2025 but nothing I tasted from this place was good at all.

This is my new favorite spot for pizza! The crust has a perfect balance of crispy and chewy, and the toppings are always fresh and flavorful. I go to the one on Lowell and the service is very good and the staff friendly. I'm especially impressed with Nick the kitchen manager, as he always goes out of his way to take care of his customers. Last time I ordered a large pizza and a calzone, he personally handed it to us and made sure everything was just as we ordered, now that's service! 10/10 I would recommend Brooklyn's Finest Pizza to anyone looking for traditional NY style pizza at a great price.

Absolutely fantastic pizza. Definitely the best I‚Äôve ever had since leaving NY. The only thing they could do to get a little closer is have a more flavorful, crispy texture to the crust, but honestly it‚Äôs so good as it is. The guy taking orders was super nice, service was fast, and lunch came out under $10 which is essentially nonexistent in this city. I‚Äôll definitely be keep coming back.

editorial_summary.overview: Cheery local pizzeria offering thin-crust pies, calzones & stromboli in a colorful, compact setting.

recentReviews.text: Solid pizza with delivery that‚Äôs not though a 3rd party. Really good housemade ranch.

Picture this: a pack of Canadians in an Airbnb, starving like wolves and on the hunt for pizza glory. As the designated pizza snob, I wasn‚Äôt about to settle for mediocre cardboard. We found these guys, and oh boy, they understood the assignment.

Online ordering? Nope. Zip codes are apparently a thing our Canadian credit cards wont do. So we called, and the guy on the phone handled our maple-leaf confusion like a champ. Delivery was lightning fast, driver was basically a pizza hero, and then the feast arrived.

Three 18-inch monsters: The Godfather, Spicy Hawaiian, and Times Square. The Spicy Hawaiian had us questioning our life choices, in the best way. The only complaint? The middle was a little floppy, but honestly, we still inhaled every slice like we hadn‚Äôt seen food in days, the flavor of each pizza was spot on.

Would we order again? Absolutely. Probably twice. Look forward to it, next time we are back in town. Cheers team, keep up the good work.
Excellent Customer Service & The Food Was Delicious. First Time Dining Here & It Won't Be Our Last.
Best pizza in Colorado according to this east coast homie
Brooklyn's Finest has my favorite slice around so far! Been here a year.
waited for 30 mins and never got two slices of pizza.  Then looked at liked we made a mistake lol

detailedReviews.author: Summer Chorn
detailedReviews.text: Solid pizza with delivery that‚Äôs not though a 3rd party. Really good housemade ranch.

detailedReviews.author: Sanjay M
detailedReviews.text:
Picture this: a pack of Canadians in an Airbnb, starving like wolves and on the hunt for pizza glory. As the designated pizza snob, I wasn‚Äôt about to settle for mediocre cardboard. We found these guys, and oh boy, they understood the assignment.

Online ordering? Nope. Zip codes are apparently a thing our Canadian credit cards wont do. So we called, and the guy on the phone handled our maple-leaf confusion like a champ. Delivery was lightning fast, driver was basically a pizza hero, and then the feast arrived.

Three 18-inch monsters: The Godfather, Spicy Hawaiian, and Times Square. The Spicy Hawaiian had us questioning our life choices, in the best way. The only complaint? The middle was a little floppy, but honestly, we still inhaled every slice like we hadn‚Äôt seen food in days, the flavor of each pizza was spot on.

Would we order again? Absolutely. Probably twice. Look forward to it, next time we are back in town. Cheers team, keep up the good work.

detailedReviews.author: Christy Garcia
detailedReviews.text: Excellent Customer Service & The Food Was Delicious. First Time Dining Here & It Won't Be Our Last.

detailedReviews.author: James C
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza in Colorado according to this east coast homie

detailedReviews.text: Brooklyn's Finest has my favorite slice around so far! Been here a year.

detailedReviews.text: Great spaghetti and meatballs!

detailedReviews.text: Solid NY slices!!!   Prices were very reasonable ...especially for 16th street.    Will be back!

Great food
Great service
The pizza is the best in colorado

detailedReviews.author: Jack Boccara
detailedReviews.text: Late night slice of pepperoni for $4.50 that had next to no flavor. If you're a NYer or know good pizza, I'm sorry to say this ain't it.

detailedReviews.author: tom awen
detailedReviews.text: Excellent hole in the wall pizzeria.  Felt like i was eating a little of New York without having to drive there.

detailedReviews.author: Heather Brasuell
detailedReviews.text: I make my homemade margarita pizza at home so when I tried Brooklyn's finest I have to say it was phenomenal like I would gladly eat their pizza and not cook at home it was so good

detailedReviews.author: Kris Williamson
detailedReviews.text: Waste of time and money

detailedReviews.author: Don Gregory
detailedReviews.text: good place

detailedReviews.author: Tim Speer
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza

detailedReviews.author: ADK
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza, chewy dough, love the cupped Pepperoni! Good ranch dressing although $1.50 for a side of ranch is absolutely ridiculous. Like, SERIOUSLY?

detailedReviews.author: Wano Yonko
detailedReviews.text:
Last time I checked (7/4/25) 2 individual supreme slices were around $9! Pretty cheap if you ask me...

Oh, and the staff/place was pretty chill too.

detailedReviews.author: Mark McMillan
detailedReviews.text: I'm disappointed that I can only give this 3 stars.  The pizza starts out fantastic when it's warm.  It's a good New York style pie.  The problem is that as it cools, it gets so tough that it‚Äôs VERY difficult to chew it.  I started out satisfied and ended thoroughly disappointed.  Don't think I would go here again.

detailedReviews.author: Miron
detailedReviews.text:
I tried to order a vegan pizza, but couldn't stomach the price it was ringing up and had to leave the restaurant hungry.
there is a significant upcharge for a vegan crust, and an additional significant upcharge for vegan cheese. a simple crust, sauce, cheese vegan pizza was ringing up close to $23 before any toppings were added.
Each added topping would have been $1-$2 extra.
Getting near $30 for a single personal vegan pizza before tax and tip is ridiculous. Do not come here if you are seeking out gluten free or vegan pizza, it's not worth it.

detailedReviews.author: Jennifer Dominquez
detailedReviews.text: We grabbed a late-night vegan pizza to go. It was like, almost 10 pm. They had a DJ and booze. Ordering was simple. We got a pizza with eggplant and meatless sausage, no dairy cheese. It was so good, and the garlic knots were the perfect side.

detailedReviews.author: Jennifer Sultzaberger (Find It Media, LLC)
detailedReviews.text: Thin crust pizza NYC comparable.

detailedReviews.author: Ranko Blazanovic
detailedReviews.text: This is my new favorite spot for pizza! The crust has a perfect balance of crispy and chewy, and the toppings are always fresh and flavorful. I go to the one on Lowell and the service is very good and the staff friendly. I'm especially impressed with Nick the kitchen manager, as he always goes out of his way to take care of his customers. Last time I ordered a large pizza and a calzone, he personally handed it to us and made sure everything was just as we ordered, now that's service! 10/10 I would recommend Brooklyn's Finest Pizza to anyone looking for traditional NY style pizza at a great price.

detailedReviews.author: Marina Cuzzocrea
detailedReviews.text: The staff was so understanding! We had just got in town and ended up at the store longer than expected and was an hour late almost to pickup our online order. Everything was still nice and hot! The food itself was fantastic we are going for seconds before heading out of town.

detailedReviews.author: Maria Luna
detailedReviews.text: This place is disgusting.  I ordered a Greek salad with chicken. They gave me 2 pounds of lettuce with 2 oz of raw chicken.  I went back, and they didn't offer to fix it. Instead, a fat, gross woman with dirty clothes came out to argue with me, convince me it was not raw. She argued that she knows it's not raw because the chickens come already cooked from the vendor. Absolutely disgusting.

detailedReviews.author: Kristin Sterling
detailedReviews.text: Big fans!  Awsome good people and service!

detailedReviews.author: Virginia J
detailedReviews.text: Consistently good pizza - thinner crust, NY style, fresh toppings. One of the best pizza spots in the area for sure.

detailedReviews.author: Steven Griger
detailedReviews.text: absolutely delicious üòã

detailedReviews.author: Derek Sheridan
detailedReviews.text: Without a doubt the least flavorful pizza I can remember. The most expensive pizza I can remember. The crust was not good at all. The ‚Äúcheesy breadsticks‚Äù were a piece of melted cheese over a piece of white bread. Maybe they were just having a bad night on Sunday 5/25/2025 but nothing I tasted from this place was good at all.

detailedReviews.author: Nick Gonzales
detailedReviews.text: The Meatball Parm Sandwich was Excellent!

detailedReviews.author: Osama Abujame
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza ever tasted in Denver !

detailedReviews.author: Cindy Romero
detailedReviews.text: By the slice!!!!

detailedReviews.author: Edward Winter
detailedReviews.text: It's an honest slice. Had a Chicago style deep dish slice. The marinara with parmesan on the side was a perfect complement. I'll be back.

detailedReviews.author: Becky Smith
detailedReviews.text: Pizza is not good at all, service was very timely and good.

detailedReviews.author: Risa Maez
detailedReviews.text: Amazingly delicious pizza

detailedReviews.author: Taras Tomkiv
detailedReviews.text: Average pizza with thin crust.

detailedReviews.author: HH D
detailedReviews.text:
-Food: we ordered New York Pizza and House Salad. They were so good, tasty.
- The price reasonable, even in downtown.
- The staff nice
-The location tight

detailedReviews.author: Matt Fisher
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza around!

detailedReviews.author: John Loland
detailedReviews.text: Ranch is $0.82 a cup

detailedReviews.author: Annmari Mercier
detailedReviews.text: Just like NY pizza

detailedReviews.author: Jaden Cash
detailedReviews.text: The service was great! I'm from new york and I really love the pizza here. The food came quick and was amazing!

detailedReviews.author: Jasmin Blue
detailedReviews.text: We ordered online and did pick up! Pizza was so tasty and ready super quick! We love trying New York style pizza every time we travel and Brooklyn‚Äôs Finest definitely hit the mark

detailedReviews.author: Yvonne Gonzalez
detailedReviews.text:
One Bite Review: 8.6

Why this pizza deserves this 8.6 One Bite review rating:

Crust‚Äînot the crispiest but has crunch and the dough has adequate flavor all on its own

Basement‚Äînot the crispiest, could have stayed in the oven for a little longer, not soggy, no large noticable "flop", not bombarded with ingredients or sauce

Sauce‚Äînot too acidic, not too sweet, not too bland, not spicy

Pepperonis‚Äîlike cup pepperoni but not thick cut and not super greasy

Cheese‚Äîhas a great cheese pull, seems like genuine good quality cheese

I added red pepper flakes, Parmesan, and garlic powder, which I feel were necessary.

detailedReviews.author: Sunaina
detailedReviews.text: Really enjoyed a large half and half Hawaiian & New York style pizza. Would definitely give the Hawaiian 5 / 5üåü

detailedReviews.author: Kurt Young
detailedReviews.text: Some of the best pizza I have ever had. I will be going back next time I'm in the area.

detailedReviews.author: Eva Perez
detailedReviews.text: Good food, limited seating.

detailedReviews.author: Terri Potter
detailedReviews.text: I ordered a slice and a glass of vino, hours before closing. Pizza and Vino awesome. Vacuuming and cleaning around me no bueno!

detailedReviews.author: Mark Kibler
detailedReviews.text: Food is amazing

detailedReviews.author: NASA1
detailedReviews.text: Moved here over a yr ago from NY , and this is by far the best pizza I've had in Colorado,  makes me feel like I'm back home . Definitely will be back for more !

detailedReviews.author: Baruky Ruiz
detailedReviews.text: Great tasting pizza for a great price.

detailedReviews.author: Jill Smith
detailedReviews.text:
This is the #1 go to spot in downtown for pizza! There is a reason why you see everyone carrying ‚ÄúBrooklyn‚Äôs Finest‚Äù pizza boxes around on the mall ;) Not only do I eat at this pizzeria personally but hire them professionally for all of my special and corporate events, casual eats needs. The Brooklyn‚Äôs Finest Team even came through for me on a super last minute event with a quick turnaround for 500 people. They rocked it! They are all so pleasant every time I am in there or over the phone. I‚Äôm also dairy free and they offer vegan cheese, vegan dough, and get my special request  of ‚Äúdairy free‚Äù right every time.
Whether you need just a slice or for catering, Carlo and his team are the ones to expedite, no doubt! Thanks again for the great pizza!

detailedReviews.author: Michael
detailedReviews.text: If this is Brooklyns finest I shudder to think of what qualifies as Brooklyns second finest. Cold, stiff, inedible.

detailedReviews.author: R O
detailedReviews.text: Not sure what this place thinks they're doing. I ordered a simple sausage and mushroom pizza and a tiramisu.  The sausage looked and tasted like bacon, and the mushrooms were completely shredded.  Not canned.  They were fresh.  But they were pulverized to the point that you could no longer even taste them.  And the tiramisu was NOT tiramisu.  No lady fingers.  More like a piece of white cake with some weird flavorless frosting that was vaguely reminiscent of a hint of tiramisu, IF you don't expect to taste espresso in your tiramisu.  The food doesn't taste bad.  It just tastes NOTHING like what you ordered.  Pretty pathetic.  If this were New York or Italy, I'd give it a zero.  But I guess for Denver, it's a 2.  The owner should be embarrassed!

detailedReviews.author: Alec Duncan
detailedReviews.text: Killer pizza. No BS.

detailedReviews.author: Miss JLH
detailedReviews.text: As someone who lived in nyc I was a little skeptical I was going to eat pizza just as good in Denver, but boy was I wrong! It was sooooo good!!!!!!

detailedReviews.author: JOHN GEORGE
detailedReviews.text: Mercedes was so helpful. You rock ...

detailedReviews.author: Sam Young
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza

detailedReviews.author: liz villalobos
detailedReviews.text: Open late amd GREAT!!! Love this place!!

detailedReviews.author: Drew Tot
detailedReviews.text: Pizza was about what I was expecting. It was good but nothing too special. Staff was nice.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.5/5 rating from 100 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers rave about the fast and reliable delivery service, with drivers being described as "pizza heroes." - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The Spicy Hawaiian pizza is a standout, leaving customers questioning their life choices "in the best way." - Boostly marketing services can amplify this
The pizzeria provides excellent customer service, handling international orders with ease and making customers feel valued. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
improvementOpportunities: Long wait times and service issues - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Negative reviews and reputation issues - review management can address this concern
Lack of atmosphere/ambiance awareness - social media marketing can improve this area

positive.author: Summer Chorn
positive.text: Solid pizza with delivery that‚Äôs not though a 3rd party. Really good housemade ranch.

positive.author: Sanjay M
positive.text:
Picture this: a pack of Canadians in an Airbnb, starving like wolves and on the hunt for pizza glory. As the designated pizza snob, I wasn‚Äôt about to settle for mediocre cardboard. We found these guys, and oh boy, they understood the assignment.

Online ordering? Nope. Zip codes are apparently a thing our Canadian credit cards wont do. So we called, and the guy on the phone handled our maple-leaf confusion like a champ. Delivery was lightning fast, driver was basically a pizza hero, and then the feast arrived.

Three 18-inch monsters: The Godfather, Spicy Hawaiian, and Times Square. The Spicy Hawaiian had us questioning our life choices, in the best way. The only complaint? The middle was a little floppy, but honestly, we still inhaled every slice like we hadn‚Äôt seen food in days, the flavor of each pizza was spot on.

Would we order again? Absolutely. Probably twice. Look forward to it, next time we are back in town. Cheers team, keep up the good work.

neutral.author: Mark McMillan
neutral.text: I'm disappointed that I can only give this 3 stars.  The pizza starts out fantastic when it's warm.  It's a good New York style pie.  The problem is that as it cools, it gets so tough that it‚Äôs VERY difficult to chew it.  I started out satisfied and ended thoroughly disappointed.  Don't think I would go here again.
